titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter describes the capture of a baghla [buggalow] Darabie by Joassemee [Qasimi] boats whilst at anchor in the roads of Magoo [Khalīj-e Moghūyeh].The boat belonged to the Imam of Muscat, but its cargo included East India Company property including twenty-one horses and some sulphur. The crew were killed during the capture and Bruce expresses his concerns over the inability to pacify the Joassemee and the safety of boats to and from India currently in the Gulf.
